perturbation.original_text: Franchisee shall continuously operate the Franchised Restaurant at the Location throughout the full term of this Agreement. Except as permitted under this Section 2.4, any failure to do so shall constitute an Event of Default under this Agreement and BKC shall be
perturbation.changed_text: Franchisee will attempt to continuously operate the Franchised Restaurant at the Location throughout the term of this Agreement. Except as permitted under this Section 2.4, any failure to do so may constitute an Event of Default under this Agreement and BKC will be
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'shall continuously operate' to 'will attempt to continuously operate' makes the obligation less strict and introduces discretion. Changing 'shall constitute' to 'may constitute' weakens the consequences of a failure to operate continuously, making it unclear whether it will be treated as a breach of contract. This change replaces a mandatory requirement with a discretionary and vague obligation, leaving enforcement open to interpretation.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law - Obligation of Continuous Operation

perturbation.original_text: The Franchisee agrees to comply strictly at all times with the Burger King System, which Franchisee acknowledges is a fundamental term of this Agreement and a necessary and reasonable requirement in the interests of the Franchisee and others operating under the Burger King System.  In particular, the Franchisee shall at all times comply with the following provisions of this Section 5.
perturbation.changed_text: The Franchisee will endeavor to comply at most times with the Burger King System, which Franchisee acknowledges is generally important to this Agreement. In particular, the Franchisee should aim to comply with the following provisions of this Section 5.
perturbation.explanation: This perturbation introduces ambiguities that weaken the franchisee's obligations. Replacing 'agrees to comply strictly at all times' with 'will endeavor to comply at most times' diminishes the rigor and consistency expected in adhering to the Burger King System. Substituting 'is a fundamental term' with 'is generally important' downplays the significance of the Burger King System to the agreement. Furthermore, changing 'shall at all times comply' to 'should aim to comply' makes the subsequent provisions recommendations rather than firm requirements.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law - Standards and Uniformity Requirements

perturbation.original_text: Franchisee agrees to carry at its expense during the Term of this Agreement Comprehensive General Liability insurance, including Products Liability and Broad Form Contractual Liability, in an amount which is at all times the local equivalent of not less than One Million U.S. Dollars (U.S.  $1,000,000.00)  per occurrence for bodily injury and Five Hundred  Thousand  U.S.  Dollars  (U.S.  $500,000.00)  per  occurrence  for property damage, or in such increased amounts as BKC may reasonably request from time to time during the Term of this  Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: Franchisee will try to carry at its expense during the Term of this Agreement General Liability insurance, including Products Liability, in an amount that is often near the local equivalent of One Million U.S. Dollars (U.S. $1,000,000.00) per occurrence. Increased amounts may be requested by BKC.
perturbation.explanation: This change makes the insurance obligation vague and potentially non-compliant with standard business practices and legal requirements. Replacing 'agrees to carry' with 'will try to carry' weakens the commitment to maintain insurance. The changes eliminate specific coverage requirements (Broad Form Contractual Liability) and introduce ambiguity about the required coverage amount.
